class_notes:
(Same as CL 220 1)
(Topic: Archeology and Art of the Bronze Age Mediterranean)
(An introductory overview of the archaeology and art of the many and varied ancient civilizations of the Bronze Age Mediterranean (3000-1000 BCE), from the great palatial societies of the Hittites, Minoans, and Mycenaeans to the mysterious Nuragic, Argaric, and Catacomb cultures. From the earliest signs of urban society to the epoch-shifting Late Bronze Age Collapse, we will consider how arts and material culture as varied as architecture, ceramics, glyptics, sculpture, and metalwork can be used to understand these ancient cultures and the complex web of trade and migration that formed the world's first truly global system. The course will consist of lectures, structured group assignments, and in-class examinations.)
Art History major/minor: Division I
Architectural Studies minor: elective
course_description: The material culture of the Greek Bronze Age architecture. ceramic, glyptic, sculpture, and metalwork; an investigation of the human activities surrounding these artifacts, the cultural systems in which they operated, the conditions and methods of production use and exchange.
